node.title: WhitespaceAfter should support LITERAL_FINALLY token
node.bodyHTML:
https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAfter

I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run
I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words

How it works Now:

/var/tmp $ javac FinallyStatement.java
/var/tmp $

/var/tmp $ cat config.xml
<!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC
        "-//Puppy Crawl//DTD Check Configuration 1.3//EN"
        "http://www.puppycrawl.com/dtds/configuration_1_3.dtd">
<module name="Checker">
    <module name="TreeWalker">
        <module name="WhitespaceAfter">
            <property name="tokens" value="LITERAL_FINALLY"/>
        </module>
    </module>
</module>

/var/tmp $ cat FinallyStatement.java
public class FinallyStatement {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            System.out.println(Integer.parseInt(args[0]));
        } finally{
            System.out.println("Finished");
        }
    }
}


/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml FinallyStatement.java
com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Token "LITERAL_FINALLY" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:476)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:403)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126)
Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Token "LITERAL_FINALLY" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.registerCheck(TreeWalker.java:223)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:133)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:471)
        ... 5 more
Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.

Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
It would be nice if checkstyle could detect missing space after finally keyword.

Describe the solution you'd like
WhitespaceAfter could support new literal type - LITERAL_FINALLY

Additional context
Google Java Style Guide requires whitespace before almost any { usage.
See https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s4.6.2-horizontal-whitespace

  1. Before any open curly brace ({), with two exceptions:
    @SomeAnnotation({a, b}) (no space is used)
    String[][] x = {{"foo"}}; (no space is required between {{, by item 9 below)

#8122 seems related. This feature request is part of it.

#11489 is similar request for try keyword support

pullRequest.title: Issue #11527: Extend TokenUtils.isOfType with more overloaded method improve performance

node.title: Extend TokenUtils.isOfType with more overloaded method improve performance
node.bodyHTML:
detected at #11371 (comment)

apply patch:

diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java
index 9dd5c13..a5ff490 100644
--- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java
+++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/TokenUtil.java
@@ -291,7 +291,23 @@ public final class TokenUtil {
         return matching;
     }
 
-    /**
+    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first) {
+        return type == first;
+    }
+
+    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first, int second) {
+        return type == first || type == second;
+    }
+
+    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first, int second, int third) {
+        return type == first || type == second || type == third;
+    }
+
+    public static boolean isOfType(int type, int first, int second, int third, int forth) {
+        return type == first || type == second || type == third || type == forth;
+    }
+
+   /**
      * Determines if the AST belongs to the given types.
      *
      * @param ast the AST node to check
@@ -303,6 +319,22 @@ public final class TokenUtil {
         return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), types);
     }
 
+    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first) {
+        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first);
+    }
+
+    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first, int second) {
+        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first, second);
+    }
+
+    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first, int second, int third) {
+        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first,second, third);
+    }
+
+    public static boolean isOfType(DetailAST ast, int first, int second, int third, int forth) {
+        return ast != null && isOfType(ast.getType(), first,second, third, forth);
+    }
+
     /**
      * Determines if given AST is a root node, i.e. if the type
      * of the token we are checking is {@code COMPILATION_UNIT}.

fix coverage:

pullRequest.title: Issue #3511: Refactoring of Scope class in API

node.title: Refactoring of Scope class in API
node.bodyHTML:
scopes - https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.3
"public, protected, and private" are called as "access modifiers" - https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.6

https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/Scope.java

contains "access modifiers" and scope level (anoninner).
Two separate terms are in one class ....... and even in API class ... .

scope - http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/property_types.html#scope
Scope was added at far history, 17d3b31

TODO:

  1. break API and make new enum/class - AccessModifier . That have only access modifiers.
  2. Scope should be moved our of API and contain anoninner only. It might be used for other scopes in future or removed completely from sources to be util method booelan isInAnnoiousInnerClass(ast)

issue is good candidate for checkstyle8 version.

usage of Scope enum:

node.title: WhitespaceAfter should support LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED token
node.bodyHTML:
https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAfter

I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run
I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words

How it works Now:

/var/tmp $ javac SynchronizedSpace.java
/var/tmp $

/var/tmp $ cat config.xml
<!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC
        "-//Puppy Crawl//DTD Check Configuration 1.3//EN"
        "http://www.puppycrawl.com/dtds/configuration_1_3.dtd">
<module name="Checker">
    <module name="TreeWalker">
        <module name="WhitespaceAfter">
            <property name="tokens" value="LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED"/>
        </module>
    </module>
</module>

/var/tmp $ cat SynchronizedSpace.java
public class SynchronizedSpace {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        synchronized(SynchronizedSpace.class) {
            System.out.println("started");
        }
    }
}


/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.1-all.jar -c config.xml SynchronizedSpace.java
com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Token "LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:476)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:403)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:330)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:189)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126)
Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Token "LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED" was not found in Acceptable tokens list in check com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace.WhitespaceAfterCheck
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.registerCheck(TreeWalker.java:223)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:133)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201)
        at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:471)
        ... 5 more
Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.

Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
It would be nice if checkstyle could detect missing space after synchronized keyword.

Describe the solution you'd like
WhitespaceAfter could support new literal type - LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED

Additional context
Google Java Style Guide requires whitespace separation of ( from any reserved words
See https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s4.6.2-horizontal-whitespace

  1. Separating any reserved word, such as if, for or catch, from an open parenthesis (() that follows it on that line

#8122 seems related. This feature request is part of it.

#11489 and #11493 are similar requests for try/finally keywords support

node.title: False Negative: VariableDeclarationUsageDistance
node.bodyHTML:
I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#VariableDeclarationUsageDistance
I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run
I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words

/var/tmp $ javac YOUR_FILE.java

/var/tmp $ cat config.xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC
        "-//Checkstyle//DTD Checkstyle Configuration 1.3//EN"
        "https://checkstyle.org/dtds/configuration_1_3.dtd">
<module name="Checker">
    <module name="TreeWalker">
        <module name="VariableDeclarationUsageDistance"/>
    </module>
</module>

/var/tmp $ cat Test.java
public class Test {
    public Test test(Object a) {
        int pc = 0; // expected violation
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test(pc).test("abc");
        return this;
    }
}

/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.3-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java
Starting audit...
Audit done.

Describe what you expect in detail.

/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.3-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java
Starting audit...
[ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:3:9: Distance between variable 'pc' declaration and its first usage is 7, but allowed 3.  Consider making that variable final if you still need to store its value in advance (before method calls that might have side effects on the original value). [VariableDeclarationUsageDistance]
Audit done.
Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.

Works perfectly fine with following piece of code-

public class Test {
    public Test test(Object a) {
        int pc = 0; // expected violation, got a violation
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test("abc").test("abc");
        test(pc);
        return this;
    }
}

node.title: update code base to have javadoc tag to explain noinspection tag content
node.bodyHTML:
detected at #11206 (comment)

code:

checkstyle/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java

Lines 628 to 635 in d4228cc

/**
* The checker threads number.
* Suppression: CanBeFinal - we use picocli and it use reflection to manage such fields
* This option has been skipped for CLI options intentionally.
*
* @noinspection CanBeFinal
*/
private static final int CHECKER_THREADS_NUMBER = DEFAULT_THREAD_COUNT;

has problems that such technical excuse of to suppress IDEA inspection is rendered in final javadoc and can confuse users.
we try to keep reasons of suppressions but in same time we do not want to expose it to users.

proposed solution is too use custom tag for this:

$ git diff
diff --git a/pom.xml b/pom.xml
index 31c2853..65fddda 100644
--- a/pom.xml
+++ b/pom.xml
@@ -433,6 +433,10 @@
                 <name>noinspection</name>
                 <placement>X</placement>
               </tag>
+              <tag>
+                <name>noinspectionreason</name>
+                <placement>X</placement>
+              </tag>
             </tags>
           </configuration>
         </plugin>
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java
index fec6cbd..f216a44 100644
--- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java
+++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java
@@ -627,8 +627,10 @@ public final class Main {
 
         /**
          * The checker threads number.
-         * Suppression: CanBeFinal - we use picocli and it use  reflection to manage such fields
-         * This option has been skipped for CLI options intentionally.
+         *
+         * @noinspectionreason CanBeFinal - we use picocli and it use
+         *     reflection to manage such fields
+         *     This option has been skipped for CLI options intentionally.
          *
          * @noinspection CanBeFinal
          */
diff --git a/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml b/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml
index de97b29..35a1ab0 100644
--- a/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml
+++ b/config/intellij-idea-inspections.xml
@@ -2797,7 +2797,7 @@
     <option name="IGNORE_JAVADOC_PERIOD" value="true"/>
     <option name="IGNORE_DUPLICATED_THROWS" value="false"/>
     <option name="IGNORE_POINT_TO_ITSELF" value="false"/>
-    <option name="myAdditionalJavadocTags" value=""/>
+    <option name="myAdditionalJavadocTags" value="noinspectionreason"/>
   </inspection_tool>
   <inspection_tool class="JavaFxColorRgb" enabled="false" level="WARNING"
                    enabled_by_default="false"/>

node.title: Update google_checks.xml to have the SuppressionCommentFilter and SuppressWarningsHolder modules in the config by default (and by extension, SuppressWarningsFilter)
node.bodyHTML:
I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run
I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words

How it works Now:

/var/tmp $ javac MyClass.java
#[[MAKE SURE THERE IS SUCCESSFUL COMPILATION]]

/var/tmp $ cat google_checks.xml
...
<module name="Checker">
  <!-- IMPORTANT: Allows use of SuppressWarnings annotation -->
  <module name="SuppressWarningsFilter"/>
  ...
  <module name="TreeWalker">
    <module name="SuppressWarningsHolder" />
    <module name="SuppressionCommentFilter">
      <property name="offCommentFormat" value="CHECKSTYLE.OFF\: ([\w\|]+)" />
      <property name="onCommentFormat" value="CHECKSTYLE.ON\: ([\w\|]+)" />
      <property name="checkFormat" value="$1" />
    </module>
...
</module>


/var/tmp $ cat MyClass.java
class MyClass {
  public void aMethod() {
  }
}


/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c google_checks.xml MyClass.java
Starting audit...
[WARN] /var/tmp/MyClass.java:2:15: Method name 'aMethod' must match pattern '^[a-z][a-z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$'. [MethodName]
Audit done.

After using @SuppressWarnings

/var/tmp $ cat MyClass.java
class MyClass {
  @SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:methodname")
  public void aMethod() {
  }
}


/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c google_checks.xml MyClass.java
Starting audit...
Audit done.

Using special comments to switch checkstyle off and on:

/var/tmp $ cat MyClass.java
class MyClass {
  // CHECKSTYLE.OFF: MethodName
  public void aMethod() {
  }
  // CHECKSTYLE.ON: MethodName
}


/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.2-all.jar -c google_checks.xml MyClass.java
Starting audit...
Audit done.

Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
No, this is just additional config in google_checks.xml.

Describe the solution you'd like
Add the ability to suppress style checks via annotations and special comments around the code. This will offer users alternatives to suppress checks other than using XML.

Additional context
Some of these changes have been already adopted by Google https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/java-repo-tools/blob/main/third_party/checkstyle/google_checks.xml

References

  • http://stackoverflow.com/a/22556386/101923
  • http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4023185

pullRequest.title: Issue #11665: Create a robust method of surviving mutation suppression

mergeCommit.message: Issue #11665: Create a robust method of surviving mutation suppression

nodes.message: minor: extract maven execution from pitest.sh

node.title: Pitest: Create robust method of surviving mutation suppression
node.bodyHTML:
Example of current Pitest script output upon failure:

Actual:
ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java.html:<td class='covered'><pre><span  class='survived'>        contextStack.clear();</span></pre></td></tr>
Ignore:

Diff:
--- target/ignored.txt  2022-05-22 09:49:25.619294919 -0400
+++ target/actual.txt   2022-05-22 09:49:25.615961595 -0400
@@ -0,0 +1 @@
+ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java.html:<td class='covered'><pre><span  class='survived'>        contextStack.clear();</span></pre></td></tr>
Difference between 'Actual' and 'Ignore' lists is detected, lists should be equal.
build will be failed.

There are several important pieces of information missing from this output:

  1. Line number
  2. Type of mutation operator
  3. Exact mutation applied

As it stands now, our surviving mutation suppression model for Pitest has some limitations:

  1. It forces maintainer to go to report to find details
  2. Allows suppression of multiple mutators in a single line

I would like output more like this:

➜  checkstyle git:(master) ✗ kotlinc ./.ci/pitest.kt pitest-sizes

Surviving mutation found.
Source File: "ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java"
Class: "com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheck"
Method: "isContainerNode"
Line Number: 232
Line Contents: "return TokenUtil.isOfType(node, TokenTypes.METHOD_DEF"
Mutator: org.pitest.mutationtest.engine.gregor.mutators.ReturnValsMutator
Description: "replaced return of integer sized value with (x == 0 ? 1 : 0)"

This will make it easier for maintainers working on pitest issues to find exact mutation to hardcode and run diff report against. There would be no need to view the pitest report.

I propose that we use kotlin or groovy (executed as a script) to create this suppression system, using the following high-level implementation:

  1. Parse pitest XML report generated by pitest execution. We can pass exact maven pitest execution in as command line args to script.
  2. Generate a POJO from each mutation node. This POJO should have an optional source field that will contain the line of source code that is being mutated (similar to existing solution).
  3. Create a collection of all generated POJOs.
  4. Remove killed mutations from collection.
  5. Compare surviving mutations to existing collection of survivors, these can also be parsed from a set of existing custom XML reports from the initial run (these are checked into Github). We will need to create some form of "fuzzy equals" to determine if we have a match between collections.
  6. Print diff to command line, in format proposed above.

This tool should have a way to print out mutation POJOs to a file as XML as our "suppression" list (see item 5 above) .

To achieve feature parity with current implementation, we should also have a "flaky survivor" collection.

Example of XML report:

<mutation detected="true" status="KILLED" numberOfTestsRun="1">
<sourceFile>ExecutableStatementCountCheck.java</sourceFile>
<mutatedClass>com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheck</mutatedClass>
<mutatedMethod>isContainerNode</mutatedMethod>
<methodDescription>(Lcom/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/DetailAST;)Z</methodDescription>
<lineNumber>232</lineNumber>
<mutator>org.pitest.mutationtest.engine.gregor.mutators.ReturnValsMutator</mutator>
<index>31</index>
<block>1</block>
<killingTest>com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheckTest.[engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes.ExecutableStatementCountCheckTest]/[method:testVisitTokenWithWrongTokenType()]</killingTest>
<description>replaced return of integer sized value with (x == 0 ? 1 : 0)</description>
</mutation>
</mutations>

This system has the advantage of not requiring maintainers to look at the reports at all; all relevant information is shown on the command line or in CI. This will speed up the mutation killing process since we will have many to deal with soon.

Comparison between surviving mutations is based on how we define equals() in our Mutation POJO. We cannot use line/ column number for equals, as this may shift around.

I propose we define equals() as the following properties being the same:

  1. Source file
  2. Mutated class
  3. Mutated Method
  4. Mutator
  5. Block (this is block of instructions, roughly each {})
  6. Description
  7. Line Contents

This may not be enough information to differentiate between mutations, however. We may need to do use the HTML report to generate POJOs and get the exact line of code from the source file OR get file contents/ exact line in script.

pullRequest.title: Issue #11710: Disable IDEA Inspection for AnnotationClass

mergeCommit.message: Issue #11710: Disable IDEA Inspection for AnnotationClass

nodes.message: Issue #7582: Adds examples to doc for LeftCurly

node.title: Disable IDEA Inspection for  `AnnotationClass`
node.bodyHTML:
The AnnotationClass inspection is a "Java Language Level" issue, which pertains to Java versions less than 1.5 (Java 5). Since we only support jdk/jre >= 11, this inspection is not relevant to the project. Sadly, the IDEA inspections website has no information about this inspection, but from the "Inspections" view in Intellij:

Reports annotation interfaces. Such interfaces are not supported in Java 1.4 and earlier JVM.

The 'assert' statement inspection pertains to Java versions less than 1.3 (Java 3). Since we only support jdk/jre >= 11, this inspection is not relevant to the project. Sadly, the IDEA inspections website also has no information about this inspection, but from the "Inspections" view in Intellij:

Reports assert statements. By default, assert statements are disabled during execution in the production environment. Consider using logger or exceptions instead. The assert statements are not supported in Java 1.3 and earlier JVM.

We can safely remove these two this inspection since we do not support language levels below 11.

node.title: Allow SuppressWarningHolder to suppress the violation with NameCheck
node.bodyHTML:
https://checkstyle.org/config_annotation.html#SuppressWarningsHolder
From the issue #11542 (comment)

$ cat Test.java
class Test {

  private static final int i = 0;

  @SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:constantnamecheck")
  private static final int m = 0;
}


$ cat config.xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC "-//Puppy Crawl//DTD Check Configuration 1.3//EN" "https://checkstyle.org/dtds/configuration_1_3.dtd">
<module name="Checker">
	<property name="charset" value="UTF-8" />
 
<module name="TreeWalker">
   <module name="ConstantName">
   </module>
   
   <module name="SuppressWarningsHolder">
	</module>
</module>

   <module name="SuppressWarningsFilter" />
</module>

$ java -jar /home/kevin/Downloads/checkstyle-10.3-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java
Starting audit...
[ERROR] /home/kevin/Desktop/C_Style/Test.java:3:28: Name 'i' must match pattern '^[A-Z][A-Z0-9]*(_[A-Z0-9]+)*$'. [ConstantName]
[ERROR] /home/kevin/Desktop/C_Style/Test.java:6:28: Name 'm' must match pattern '^[A-Z][A-Z0-9]*(_[A-Z0-9]+)*$'. [ConstantName]
Audit done.
Checkstyle ends with 2 errors.

Expected no violation at line no:-6 as we are using @SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:constantnamecheck")

Attention: documentation must be updated to mention in words that this is possible, not example is reqired (as it is rarely used names, in all docs all names are without Check).

pullRequest.title: Issue #11727: Include CDG Accelerator Plugin to boost pitest performance

mergeCommit.message: Issue #11727: Include CDG Accelerator Plugin to boost pitest performance

nodes.message: Issue #11720: Kill surviving mutation in FinalLocalVariableCheck related to if statement

node.title: Include CDG Accelerator Plugin to boost pitest performance
node.bodyHTML:
Pitest takes a significant amount of time to execute in the CI, there are ways in which this time can be improved. Fast feedback form CI will be important in long run and will be super important for this summer's project.

The CDG Accelerator Plugin or the JUnit 5 Accelerator Plugin claims to improves mutation test performance by reducing the overhead in running tests that use a limited set of JUnit Jupiter features. Tests that use only these features will run more quickly, tests that use features outside this set will be executed as normal.

See https://docs.arcmutate.com/docs/accelerator.html#eligible-tests section for the eligible tests.

A license needs to be acquired in order to use the plugin, it is free for open-source projects.
See https://www.arcmutate.com/pricing/ for more details.

node.title: Pitest: Kill all surviving mutations
node.bodyHTML:
This will be main tracker issue for killing surviving mutations before we begin work in #11719

Now that we have diff report generation as github action, let's modify the procedure from #7797 (comment) a bit to speed this up:

  1. Disable all CI first as separate commit(See example at #11721). This will help to not waste credits.
  2. Pick one single surviving mutation from pitest.sh.
  3. Send PR with a single hardcoded mutation only.
  4. Generate diff report with hardcoded mutation.
  5. Share link to initial commit with hardcoded mutation and initial diff report in PR description. This is in lieu of separate branch/ etc. in previous issue at #7797.

HARDCODED MUTATION WILL NOT BE IN FINAL PR.

We will have one of three outcomes for each mutation (in order of preference):

  1. Find a case that kills the mutation via diff report, add new test in existing PR
  2. Safely (no regressions) modify code to be covered, in existing PR
  3. Safely (no regressions) remove code to be covered, in existing PR

Case (2) and (3) required a detailed analysis and discussion in issue before making any changes.

We will not be pursuing surviving mutations in IndentationCheck or gui package .

node.title: create Github action that does version bump and update of milestone
node.bodyHTML:
https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/blob/master/releasenotes-builder/diagrams.md

top and most botton actions of Maintainer is just a version bump to required version and update Github milestone.
we need to have github action that can do this for maintainers.
So this will help to avoid manual operation in terminal by maintainers and just trigger Github action with definition of version and it does job.

So in case of release of bug fix (10.3.1) user will do:

  1. trigger Githib action to update 10.4-SNAPSHOT to 10.3.1-SNAPSHOT
  2. trigger release
  3. trigger Githib action to update 10.3.2-SNAPSHOT to 10.4-SNAPSHOT

we need automation for step 1 and 3.

node.title: Adding CheckForVariable function to util.sh
node.bodyHTML:
Whenever we add a token or key, it is important to check if it exists before we run the shell script.

Currently, I am using this function in the release project but as we use a lot of tokens in different shell scripts, we need to make a general function in util.sh so that we can call this function and remove repetition of creating this function.

Function:

checkForVariable() {
    if [[ "$(declare -p "$1")" =~ ^declare\ -x ]]; then
       echo "Error: Define $1 environment variable"
       exit 1
    fi
}

Usage:
checkForVariable "TOKEN_NAME"

I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words

/var/tmp $ javac Test.java
/var/tmp $ cat config.xml
<!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC

</module>
/var/tmp $ cat Test.java
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;

public class Test {

    public BufferedReader instFld2;

     void method() {
        try (BufferedReader instFld2 = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(null, "utf-8"))) {
        }
        catch (IOException e) {
        }
    }
}
/var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"
/var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-10.3.1-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java

node.title: Reuse Plain text release notes from releasenotes-builder in Github release page
node.bodyHTML:
page https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/releases/tag/checkstyle-10.3
right now we post only link to release notes.

but we can use Plain text content of releasenotes builder to generate new post in Github format.
Keep "Plan text" unchanged and create new template and "Github post":

We can add #XXXX at the begining of text lines so links will be active and easy to use.
#XXXXXX: title
we need to keep grouping of issue as it is now in Plan text release notes.

no links to issues for Notes section!!!
Example plain text released notes generation https://cloud.drone.io/checkstyle/checkstyle/11388/4/2

Structure of new post:

Checkstyle 10.4 - https://checkstyle.org/releasenotes.html#Release_10.4

Breaking compatibility:
  #xxxx - Change ....

New features:
  #xxxx - Support ....

Bug fixes:
  #xxxx - Support qualified annotation names
  #xxxx - Update google_checks.xml to have the SuppressionCommentFilter and SuppressWarningsHolder modules in the config by default (and by extension, SuppressWarningsFilter)


Notes:
  Pitest: Kill all surviving mutations
  update code base to have javadoc tag to explain noinspection tag content
  doc: put example of enableExternalDtdLoad to xdoc
  update doc for SuppressWarningsHolder
  releasenotes script generated empty commit
  Include CDG Accelerator Plugin to boost pitest performance
  Enforce file size on Java inputs
  Expand XPath IT Regression Testing
  There are semantic problems in the Chinese error message of keyword `design.forExtension` .
  prepare-settings.sh fails to create settings.xml
  Use groovy version provided by `apt` in pitest.yml
  Solve fb-contrib errors
  tweet-releasenotes.sh does not check env variables
  download of m2 cache from sourceforge.io is slow 
  infra: turns off create dependency reduced pom for shade plugin
  Update Tests to use new 'verifyXxxxxx' method or 'execute' that use inlined config in Input files
  Specify violation messages in input files.
  pitest: increase mutation coverage for javadoc profile to 100%

==============================================

This will make github release page be more readable.

We do update of this page at

checkstyle/release.sh

Line 65 in 8c7e41a

echo "Updating Github tag page"

example of release notes page https://github.com/hcoles/pitest/releases/tag/1.9.0

It should be a script that takes Github token from file as it is done in release.sh and do update over existing release page. Eventually it will be executed from release.sh script as just another command.

CS_RELEASE_VERSION="$(getCheckstylePomVersion)"
